004package kut;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008
009/** 'byte[]' management. */
010public class Bytes {
011  Bytes () {}
012
013  /**
014   * Creates a 'byte[]' of length 'len', intialized with 0's.<p>
015   * If 'len' &lt; 0, it is set to 0.
016   * @param len Array size.
017   * @return A new array.
018   */
019  public static byte[] mk (int len) {
020    if (len < 0) len = 0;
021    byte[] r = new byte[len];
022    Arrays.fill(r, (byte)0);
023    return r;
024  }
025
026  /**
027   * Converts an ArrayList to 'byte[]'.
028   * @param a Array to convert.
029   * @return A new array.
030   */
031  public static byte[] fromArr (ArrayList<Byte> a) {
032    int sz = a.size();
033    Byte[] bs = a.toArray(new Byte[sz]);
034    byte[] r = new byte[sz];
035    for (int i = 0; i < sz; ++i) r[i] = bs[i];
036    return r;
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Converts a 'byte[]' to ArrayList.
041   * @param bs Array to convert.
042   * @return A new array.
043   */
044  public static ArrayList<Byte> toArr (byte[] bs) {
045    int sz = bs.length;
046    Byte[] bbs = new Byte[sz];
047    for (int i = 0; i < sz; ++i) bbs[i] = bs[i];
048    return new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(bbs));
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Converts a String to 'byte[]' codified in "UTF-8".
053   * @param s String to convert.
054   * @return A new array.
055   */
056  public static byte[] fromStr (String s) {
057    try {
058      return s.getBytes("UTF-8");
059    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
060      throw new IllegalArgumentException (e);
061    }
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Converts a 'byte[]' codified in "UTF-8" to String.
066   * @param bs Array to convert.
067   * @return A new String.
068   */
069  public static String toStr (byte[] bs) {
070    try {
071      return new String(bs, "UTF-8");
072    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
073      throw new IllegalArgumentException (e);
074    }
075  }
076
077  /**
078   * Adds two 'byte[]'.
079   * @param bs1 First array.
080   * @param bs2 Second array.
081   * @return A new array equals to bs1 + bs2.
082   */
083  public static byte[] add (byte[] bs1, byte[] bs2) {
084    int sz1 = bs1.length;
085    int sz2 = bs2.length;
086    byte[] r = Arrays.copyOf(bs1, sz1 + sz2);
087    System.arraycopy(bs2, 0, r, sz1, sz2);
088    return r;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Returns the n first elements of 'bs'.<p>
093   * If 'len' &lt; 0, it is set to 0.<p>
094   * If 'len' &gt; bs.length, all the array is returned.
095   * @param bs Array to truncate.
096   * @param n Bytes to keep in.
097   * @return A new array.
098   */
099  public static byte[] take (byte[] bs, int n) {
100    if (n < 0) n = 0;
101    else if (n > bs.length) n = bs.length;
102    return Arrays.copyOf(bs, n);
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Returns the remains elements after removing those witch are returned by
107   * 'take'.
108   * @param bs Array to truncate.
109   * @param n Bytes to remove.
110   * @return A new array.
111   */
112  public static byte[] drop (byte[] bs, int n) {
113    int sz = bs.length;
114    if (n < 0) n = 0;
115    else if (n > sz) n = sz;
116    return Arrays.copyOfRange(bs, n, sz);
117  }
118}
